sen.j: 祭神天忍穂耳命栲幡千々姫命饒速日命
sen.e: The enshrined deities are Amenooshihomimi no Mikoto, Takuhatachijihime no Mikoto and Nigihaya no Mikoto.
The enshrined deities are Amenooshihomimi no Mikoto, Takuhatachijihime no Mikoto and Nigihaya no Mikoto.

sen.j: 岩屋神社（いわやじんじゃ）は、京都府京都市山科区にある神社である。
sen.e: The Iwaya-jinja Shrine is in Yamashina-ku, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The Iwaya-jinja Shrine is in Yamashina-ku, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The Iwaya-jinja Shrine is in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 近代社格制度では郷社。
sen.e: It is designated as a village shrine in the modern shrine ranking system.
It is designated as a village shrine in the modern shrine ranking system.
It is designated as a village shrine in the modern shrine ranking system.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳名神大社「山城国宇治郡 山科神社二座」に擬せられた時もあったが、現在は否定されている。
sen.e: There was a period that the shrine was considered a Myojin-taisha Shrine "Yamashiro-jinja Shrine Niza in Uji District, Yamachiro Province" in Engishiki Jinmyocho (the list of deities), however it is denied today.

There was a period where the shrine was considered a Myojin-taisha Shrine "Yamashiro-jinja Shrine Niza in Uji District, Yamachiro Province" in Engishiki Jinmyocho (the list of deities), which is now denied.

sen.cmt: 記号を修正しました。スペル修正しました。

sen.j: アメノオシホミミと栲幡千々姫命、および両神の子のニギハヤヒを祀る。
sen.e: It worships a couple of gods, Amenooshihomimi and Takuhatachijihime and their child, Nigihayahi
The temple is a place of worship for several gods, Amenooshihomimi and Takuhatachijihime and their child, Nigihayahi
The temple is a place of worship for several gods, Amenooshihomimi and Takuhatachijihime and their child, Nigihayahi
History
History
History

sen.j: 本殿背後の山腹に奥之院あるいは岩屋殿と呼ばれる陰陽2つの巨巌があり、これを磐座として祀ったのが当社の起源である。
sen.e: There are two huge rocks, the symbol of yin and yang, called Okunoin or Iwayaden on the mountainside behind the Honden (the main building of the shrine) and worshiping these rocks as dwelling place of god originated the shrine.

There are two huge rocks, the symbols of yin and yang, called Okunoin or Iwayaden on the mountainside behind the Honden (the main building of the shrine) and worshiping these rocks as a dwelling place of the gods originated at this shrine.

There are two huge rocks, the symbols of yin and yang, called Okunoin or Iwayaden on the mountainside behind the Honden (the main building of the shrine) and worshiping these rocks as a dwelling place of the gods originated at this shrine.

sen.j: 社伝では、仁徳天皇31年の創建と伝えられる。
sen.e: It is built in 343 according to the shrine's biography.
It was built in 343 according to the shrine's biography.
It was built in 343 according to the shrine's biography.

sen.j: 寛平年間、陰巌に栲幡千千姫命、陽巌に天忍穂耳命を祀り、岩前の小祠に饒速日命が祀られた。
sen.e: During the Kanpyo ear (889 to 898) Takuhatachijihime no Mikoto was worshiped in the huge rock of yin, Amenooshihomii no Mikoto was worshiped in the huge rock of yang and Nigihaya no Mikoto was worshiped in the small shrine in front of the rocks.

During the Kanpyo ear (889 to 898) the huge rock of yin was worshiped as Takuhatachijihime no Mikoto, and the huge rock of yangwas worshiped as Amenooshihomii no Mikoto while the small shrine in front of the rocks was worshiped as Nigihaya no Mikoto.

During the Kanpyo ear (889 to 898) the huge rock of yin was worshiped as Takuhatachijihime no Mikoto, and the huge rock of yang was worshiped as Amenooshihomii no Mikoto while the small shrine in front of the rocks was worshiped as Nigihaya no Mikoto.
sen.cmt: スペース挿入しました。

sen.j: これは、物部氏系の大宅氏が、山科を開拓するに当たり祖神を祀ったものである。
sen.e: These worships were for the ancestors of Oyake family from the Mononobe clan when they developed Yamashina area.
Prayers were made for the ancestors of Oyake family from the Mononobe clan when they developed the Yamashina area.
Prayers were made for the ancestors of Oyake family from the Mononobe clan when they developed the Yamashina area.

sen.j: 治承年間（1177年 - 1180年）に園城寺僧徒によって社殿が焼かれ、旧記も失われた。
sen.e: During the Jisho era (1177-1180), the main building of the shrine were burned down by the monks of Onjo-ji Temple and all of the old documents were burned as well.
During the Jisho era (1177-1180), the main building of the shrine was burned down by the monks of Onjo-ji Temple and all of the old documents were burned as well.
During the Jisho era (1177-1180), the main building of the shrine was burned down by the monks of Onjo-ji Temple and all of the old documents were burned as well.

sen.j: 弘長2年（1262年）に再建された。
sen.e: It was rebuilt in 1262.
It was rebuilt in 1262.
It was rebuilt in 1262.

sen.j: 中世には「東西上の岩屋三社」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: It was called "The three iwaya (rocks) shrines in east, west and on the top" in the Middle Ages.
It was called "The three iwaya (rocks) shrines in east, west and on the top" in the Middle Ages.
It was called 'The three iwaya (rocks) shrines in east, west and on the top' in the Middle Ages.

sen.j: 東岩屋が岩屋神社、西岩屋が山科神社であるが、上岩屋が何に当たるかは不明である。
sen.e: East rock is the Iwaya-jinja Shrine, west rock is Yamashiro-jinja Shrine but it is not known what shrine was on the top rock.
East rock is the Iwaya-jinja Shrine, west rock is Yamashiro-jinja Shrine but it is not known what shrine was on the top rock.
East rock is the Iwaya-jinja Shrine, west rock is Yamashiro-jinja Shrine but it is not known what shrine was on the top rock.

sen.j: 明治6年（1873年）郷社に列し、戦後は神社本庁に属す。
sen.e: In 1873, it was listed as a village shrine and belonged to the Association of Shinto Shrines after the war.
In 1873, it was listed as a village shrine and belonged to the Association of Shinto Shrines after the war.
